title: Trying to connect solr to tomcat container

comments.content:
First of all, there's no data here to help you solve your issue.

Second this is not an appropriate use of Solr's JIRA, the issue tracker is not a support portal. We try to reserve the JIRA system for code issues rather than usage questions.

 Please ask the question here: solr-user@lucene.apache.org, see: http://lucene.apache.org/solr/community.html#mailing-lists-irc

 When you raise question on the user's list, include pertinent details, including sample data, queries and responses if possible, along with what you expect to see but don't.
comments.author: Erick Erickson

comments.content:
I have been attempting to connect the official solr 7.4 container found on hub.docker.com to a Tomcat container running on port 8080, the Tomcat instance is fronted but a separate httpd apache server which is publishing static content.  I have the apache connecting to the tomcat and the solr containers.

I mapped the solr container to the cmscontent I am using on the tomcat and the apache.  I have created a solr user on the apache and the tomcat containers and I have added solr each as a group, but I cannot get the solr container to index any of the files and run.

Is there someone who can assist with the path or the sets I need to make it work?  I even tried to build a fresh box  with no joy
comments.author: Ray Oh

comments.content: Thanks for the guidance and apologies for using the Jira in the inappropriate way.  I will try the suggested path
